solution_line_template: If Karen's {karen_crayons} crayons were twice as many as were in Beatrice's box, there were {karen_crayons}/{karen_beatrice_factor}=<<{karen_crayons}/{karen_beatrice_factor}={beatrice_crayons}>>{beatrice_crayons} crayons in Beatrice's box.

And since Beatrice's box contained twice as many crayons as were in Gilbert's box of crayons, then Gilbert had {beatrice_crayons}/{beatrice_gilbert_factor}=<<{beatrice_crayons}/{beatrice_gilbert_factor}={gilbert_crayons}>>{gilbert_crayons} crayons.
And since Gilbert had four times as many crayons as Judah, then Judah had {gilbert_crayons}/{gilbert_judah_factor}=<<{gilbert_crayons}/{gilbert_judah_factor}={judah_crayons}>>{judah_crayons} crayons.
